title: CRLF injection

profile.name: Twitter
profile.about: Twitter helps you create and share ideas and information instantly, without barriers.

vulnerability_information:
Hello twiiter security team,


on the domain ads.twitter.com http response splitting is vulnerability.


PoC:
https://ads.twitter.com/subscriptions/mobile/landing?ref=gl-tw-tw-promote-mode?t=%0d%0atest:tested

## Impact

an attacker can set new header
vulnerability_information_html:
Hello twiiter security team,

on the domain ads.twitter.com http response splitting is vulnerability.

PoC:
https://ads.twitter.com/subscriptions/mobile/landing?ref=gl-tw-tw-promote-mode?t=%0d%0atest:tested

Impact

an attacker can set new header

activities.message: This vulnerability could be used in combination with others. For example, XSS via Cookie, session fixation or bypass Double-Submit Cookie CSRF protection.
activities.markdown_message: This vulnerability could be used in combination with others. For example, XSS via Cookie, session fixation or bypass Double-Submit Cookie CSRF protection.

activities.message: and also this vulnerability works in all modern browsers.
activities.markdown_message: and also this vulnerability works in all modern browsers.

activities.message:
Hello @s3c,

My apologies for the delay - the team is still discussing the bounty eligibility. I will post any updates here as I receive them.
In the meantime, thank you for confirming that the vulnerability has been addressed.

Thank you for your patience and for thinking of Twitter security!
activities.markdown_message:
Hello @s3c,

My apologies for the delay - the team is still discussing the bounty eligibility. I will post any updates here as I receive them.
In the meantime, thank you for confirming that the vulnerability has been addressed.

Thank you for your patience and for thinking of Twitter security!

activities.message:
Thanks again for helping us keep Twitter safe and secure for our users! 

We recently received a number of reports about CRLF on various endpoints on twitter.com. These issues have the same underlying root cause, and would normally be closed as a duplicate of the first report. However, since these issues were independently discovered, reported and triaged in roughly the same time, and are generally difficult for researchers to root-cause as a duplicate, we are paying these initial reports out. While we continue to address this issue, please refrain from submitting any more reports demonstrating this issue on other endpoints on twitter.com. In the future, please note that if your report has already been reported by another researcher, it will be marked as a duplicate.
activities.markdown_message:
Thanks again for helping us keep Twitter safe and secure for our users!

We recently received a number of reports about CRLF on various endpoints on twitter.com. These issues have the same underlying root cause, and would normally be closed as a duplicate of the first report. However, since these issues were independently discovered, reported and triaged in roughly the same time, and are generally difficult for researchers to root-cause as a duplicate, we are paying these initial reports out. While we continue to address this issue, please refrain from submitting any more reports demonstrating this issue on other endpoints on twitter.com. In the future, please note that if your report has already been reported by another researcher, it will be marked as a duplicate.

activities.message: Hi!   First of all, thanks for this find!   We've corrected the issue internally, but we're checking whether other use cases (eg, users of open source Finagle) are likely to be affected.  If they are, we want to be able to address it properly rather than catching them out right before the holidays!  For their sake, we'd like to get to this early January.
activities.markdown_message: Hi! First of all, thanks for this find! We've corrected the issue internally, but we're checking whether other use cases (eg, users of open source Finagle) are likely to be affected. If they are, we want to be able to address it properly rather than catching them out right before the holidays! For their sake, we'd like to get to this early January.

summaries.content:
https://ads.twitter.com was vulnerability to HTTP response splitting in the endpoint https://ads.twitter.com/subscriptions/mobile/landing that allows to an attacker add a malicious header in the response headers. 

PoC:
https://ads.twitter.com/subscriptions/mobile/landing?t=%0d%0aSet-Cookie:%20csrf_id=injection%3b
summaries.content_html:
https://ads.twitter.com was vulnerability to HTTP response splitting in the endpoint https://ads.twitter.com/subscriptions/mobile/landing that allows to an attacker add a malicious header in the response headers.

PoC:
https://ads.twitter.com/subscriptions/mobile/landing?t=%0d%0aSet-Cookie:%20csrf_id=injection%3b
